==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じょう|ず}}
{{IPAchar|/d͡ʑauzu/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑɔːzu/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑoːzu/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じょうず}} compound {{m|zh|上手|tr=dzyang<sup>H</sup> syuw<sup>X</sup>|lit=top hand||to have the upper hand → to gain mastery, to master something}}.

This reading is likely a later innovation in Japanese after the initial borrowing. This uses the [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] of ''jō'' for the first character, and the [[慣用音#Japanese|kan'yōon]] of ''zu'' for the second character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|じょうず|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=な|じょうず|hhira=じやうず}}

# [[skillful]], [[dexterous]]

=====Inflection=====
{{ja-na|じょうず}}

=====Antonyms=====
* {{ja-r|下手|へた}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょうず|hhira=じやうず}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=じょうず|rare}} [[skill]], [[dexterity]]
# [[flattery]] {{qualifier|from being told how skillful one is, even if one isn't}}
#: {{ja-usex|いつもお'''上手'''をいわれて自惚れた。|^いつも お'''じょうず''' を いわれて うぬぼれた。|He was always told '''flattering things''' and got full of himself.}}
# a person with the [[seventh]] [[dan]] in the games of [[shogi]] or [[go]]

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|skill, dexterity}} {{ja-r|下手|へた}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じょう|しゅ}}
{{IPAchar|/d͡ʑauɕu/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑɔːɕu/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑoːɕu/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じょうず}} compound {{m|zh|上手|tr=dzyang<sup>H</sup> syuw<sup>X</sup>|lit=top hand||to have the upper hand → to gain mastery, to master something}}.

This is the [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading for both characters, so likely the reading as initially borrowed.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|じょうしゅ|acc=3}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=な|じょうしゅ|hhira=じやうしゆ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=じょうしゅ|obsolete}} ''same as ''jōzu'' reading above''

=====Usage notes=====
Obsolete. Replaced by the ''jōzu'' reading above.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょうしゅ|hhira=じやうしゆ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=じょうしゅ|obsolete}} ''same as ''jōzu'' reading above''

=====Usage notes=====
Obsolete. Replaced by the ''jōzu'' reading above.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=j|じょう|て}}
{{IPAchar|/d͡ʑaute/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑɔːte/}} → {{IPAchar|/d͡ʑoːte/}}

Variation on ''jōzu'' above, replacing the [[慣用音#Japanese|kan'yōon]] of ''zu'' with the [[訓読み#Japanese|kun'yomi]] of ''te''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=j|じょうて|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょうて|hhira=じやうて}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=じょうて|rare}} alternate for ''jōzu'' above
# {{abbreviation of|lang=ja|sort=じょうて|上手物|nodot=1}} (''jōtemono''): an [[exquisite]] piece of [[workmanship]]

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|crude piece of workmanship}} {{ja-r|下手物|げてもの}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うわ|て}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=うわて|上|tr1=uwa|t1=up, upper|手|tr2=te|t2=hand}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うわて|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=na|うわて}}

# [[superior]], [[better]]
# [[aggressive]], [[bold]], on the [[offensive]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|aggressive, bold, on the offensive}} {{ja-r|高飛車|たかびしゃ}}

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|unaggressive, modest, on the defensive}} {{ja-r|下手|したて}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うわて}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=うわて|sumo}} an [[overhand]] [[hold]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=うわて|sumo}} the [[upper]] [[hand]] in an [[overhand]] [[hold]]
# [[upstream]], the upstream portion of a [[river]]
# [[upwind]]
# a [[skilled]] [[player]] of games, such as [[go]] or [[shogi]]

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|downstream, downwind, stage right}} {{ja-r|下手|しもて}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かみ|て}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かみて|上|tr1=kami|t1=up, upper|手|tr2=te|t2=hand}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かみて|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かみて}}

# [[upstream]], the upstream portion of a [[river]]
# [[upwind]]
# [[uphill]], the [[upper]] portion of a [[hill]] or other [[geographic]] [[feature]]
# the [[head]] of a [[table]], the [[seat]] of [[honor]]
# [[stage left]]: the [[left-hand]] side of a [[stage]] when looking from the stage towards the [[audience]]
# the [[left-hand]] side of a [[drawstring]] on a [[fishing]] [[net]]

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|downstream, downwind, stage right}} {{ja-r|下手|しもて}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
{{IPAchar|/kamute/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaute/}} → {{IPAchar|/kɔːte/}} → {{IPAchar|/koːte/}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=こうて|上|tr1=kamu|t1=up, upper|手|tr2=te|t2=hand}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|こうて}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こうて|hhira=かうて}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=こうて|rare}} the [[left-hand]] side of a [[drawstring]] on a [[fishing]] [[net]]
